features: 2024 Newest Kids Tablet - Aiprotablet Kids Tablet is powered by Android 13 operating system with a 4-core processor, 4GB (2+2) RAM, 64GB ROM, WIFI, GPS, Bluetooth support to ensure the tablet runs fast and smooth. Expansion to 512GB via SD card lets you store the files and applications you need.

Learning Through Play - This kids tablet is GMS certified with full access to Google services, parents can download tons of educational apps from Google App Store. Kids can enjoy math, language, music and drawing in games, and we believe this tablet can be the best learning partner for your kids.

Excellent User Experience - The 10-inch Kids Tablet features a 1280x800 IPS HD touchscreen with low blue light technology, open viewing angles, vibrant colors, and a large 6000mAh battery for uninterrupted use. Each tablet comes with a soft silicone case to protect against drops and bumps.

Gifts for Kids - Ensure healthy tablet use by filtering and selecting content for your child with parental controls and setting screen time limits. This tablet is perfect as a gift for your child at Christmas, birthdays, and all kinds of holidays.

100% Guarantee - Package Information: tablet x 1, protective case x 1, Type-C cable, user manual x 1. We are a professional tablet manufacturer, the return period of the tablet sold is extended to 90 days, you can return it without any reason, and we provide a two-year warranty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great budget tablet for kids
reviews.reviewText: The title states it is an Android 12 tablet, the description says Android 11, and the actual tablet is indeed Android 12. The tablet is thin and light, it doesn't look cheap or low quality, but it is way too light makes you wonder if the tablet is made of pure plastic. It feels much better after putting on the silicon gel protector. I got the feeling the plastic stand in the back of the silicon gel will break soon, but we will see. The charging port is USB-C, which is a big plus. The tablet did not come with a charger, only a USB to USB-C charging cable. It charges fine in the USB port on my extension power strip and the USB charger came with an iPhone or Amazon Fire stick. The battery lasts about 4-5 hours, which is not bad at all.CPU model is indeed SC7731E, but it Quad-Core ARM Cortex A7 runs at 1.3GHz instead of Quad-Core ARM CortexTM A55 MP8 at 1.4GHz stated in the description. Total RAM is 2Gb instead of 3Gb in description and internal storage is indeed 64Gb. Screen size 10.1 1280x800 resolution as stated. GPS functions correctly, Wifi only supports 2.4 GHz and can not detect 5 GHz wifi, which is the major significant downside of this tablet. The download speed for Wi-Fi is about 5.8mbps while my iPhone gets 104mbps when connected to the same router but 5GHz Wi-Fi. Basically, you get what you paid for. The description stated configuration is not realistic in the $50 price range at this moment TBH.Set the specs aside, the performance of this tablet is ok, very ok. I mean you don't feel the responsiveness you get on your iPhone for sure, but you don't feel it is terribly slow either. It will become very slow if you install too many apps or run out of internal storage space, so you need to have a clear definition of what apps you want to keep on this tablet. I keep YouTube, Kindle, PrimeVideo, VLC, Amazon, eBay, Facebook, etc. because I define it as reading and video streaming devices. Light games such as Sudoku, Water Sort, and Plant vs. Zombie work just fine.This tablet came with the app iWawa, which is an educational app for kids. This app makes me wish I had bought this tablet earlier. If you have an Android tablet, check if you can install this app, highly recommended for babies and kids. Sadly it is not available for iPhone or iPad, but now I'm glad I bought this tablet. My original plan is to use this low-end Android tablet as a reading, shopping, and video streaming device while I do my game mission on my iPhone, now I have to do all this on my daughter's iPad Air3.In summary, screw the specs, if you have kids 2-8 years old, and you want a cheap but reasonable quality Android tablet to run iWawa, this one is more than good enough. It also works as a good enough low-end Android tablet as a reading, shopping, YouTube, and video streaming device, whenever your kids are not allowed to use the tablet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not worth your money
reviews.reviewText: I got this for my daughter for Christmas and a month later it won't turn on or do anything. It started freezing up and running extremely slow then two days later NOTHING. Thankfully Amazon did refund me my money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Very GLITCHY and takes a long time to load games.
reviews.reviewText: My daughter wanted this to play games on but it takes a really long time to load them and then, when playing, they are as she says, "Glitchy". We aren't sure if we are going to keep it or return it, due to these issues. We will try it out for another 2 weeks before deciding. It looks nice though.
